intro: Psammisia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils, often in coastal or dry regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces violet or blue flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
